definition: hatred/animosity/enmity/foe/enemy/to feel animosity toward (the wealthy, foreigners etc)
when the enemies come face to face, their eyes blaze with hatred (idiom)
pinyin: chou2 ren2 xiang1 jian4 , fen4 wai4 yan3 hong2

sentences.english: You have exalted the right hand of his foes, have gladdened all his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 你高舉了他仇人的右手，使他的敵人都滿心歡愉。

sentences.english: Kindness to the enemy means cruelty to the people. (p. 163)
sentences.chinese: 對仇人的慈悲便是對人平易近的殘酷。

sentences.english: A thousand friends are few one enemy is too many.
sentences.chinese: 同伴千人尚覺少，仇人一人猶嫌多。

sentences.english: This one you might. The head of an old foe.
sentences.chinese: 這個可能是例外，一個老仇人的。

sentences.english: I want him to identify him enemy Tong Pak Fu.
sentences.chinese: 讓他當面認一下，他不共戴天的仇人唐伯虎。

sentences.english: Didnt think the past enemies come to kill her family.
sentences.chinese: 沒想到過去的仇人找上門來要置霍家於死地。

sentences.english: Yet count him not as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother.
sentences.chinese: 但不要以他爲仇人，要勸他如弟兄。

sentences.english: QinQiong think over and over, still cannot pass patricide enemy.
sentences.chinese: 秦瓊左思右想，始終無法放過殺父仇人。

sentences.english: That guy revenged on his enemy by planning to kill two birds with one stone .
sentences.chinese: 那傢伙計劃用一石二鳥的方法向仇人報復。

sentences.english: If thou meet thy enemy's ox or ass going astray, bring it back to him.
sentences.chinese: 假使你遇見你仇人的牛或驢迷了路，應給他領回去。

sentences.english: Uttering bare truth, even so as foes commend.
sentences.chinese: 赤的真理，連仇人也無法掩蓋。

sentences.english: Prince saw an enemy particularly jealous, spot called hand during the siege.
sentences.chinese: 太子一見仇人分外眼紅，當場招呼手下圍攻李世民。

sentences.english: Unexpectedly, several days later, He Yuqing the father became Wei Kang to kill the father personal enemy unexpectedly.
sentences.chinese: 不料，幾天後，何雨晴的父親竟成了韋康的殺父仇人。

sentences.english: BE during the days in the high school of sworn enemies, the personal enemy meet, cent outside jealous.
sentences.chinese: 原來是中學時的死對頭，仇人相見，分外眼紅。

sentences.english: For all their modern weapons, the enemy were eventually defeated.
sentences.chinese: 仇人固然有着當代化的兵器，但終於還是被打敗了。

definition: (of enemies) cannot live under the same sky/absolutely irreconcilable
a benefactor/a person who has significantly helped sb else
to start a feud/to become enemies
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
to quarrel/to fall out with sb
to carry out a vendetta against sb
to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
hatred/animosity/enmity/foe/enemy/to feel animosity toward (the wealthy, foreigners etc)
to fight to one's last gasp
